field.name: pathnote
field.label: Image Paths
field.description: These set the default folders for posters and pictures. This is only used as the starting point when inserting images, you can then navigate to any other folder under /images if you wish. The defaults are /images/xbfilms which is created on installation.

field.name: portrait_path
field.label: Portrait images folder
field.description: Default folder for picture for people and characters. This only constrains which folder is initially shown when selecting image

field.name: def_new_percat
field.label: New Person Category
field.description: Default category for all new and imported people. You can select a different category when creating an individual item, and a different default for a specific import. This just provides a general fallback - if not set it will default to 'Uncategorised'.

field.name: people_sort
field.label: Name Order
field.description: In all views names are displayed as 'Firstnames Lastname'. List views can be sorted by both Lastname and Firstname. This setting determines the order for name lists used in selectors (eg in seach/filter options) which will be listed alphabetically according to tis setting.

field.name: def_new_charcat
field.label: New Character Category
field.description: Default category for all new and imported characters. You can select a different category when creating an individual item, and a different default for a specific import. This just provides a general fallback - if not set it will default to 'Uncategorised'.

field.name: extlink_target
field.label: External Link Target
field.description: Open external links in new tab/window or replace existing page. NB this only applies to links added in the 'External Links' field for Films and People.

fieldset.name: meta
fieldset.label: Metadata
fieldset.description: These options only affect the metadata for xbfilms pages. If they are left blank the defaults from System|Global Configuration|Site will be used.

field.name: metanote1
field.description: Default values/options specified below are only used when a new item is first saved. Once there is data in the metadata fields then that will be used. The individual 'Show' options below are used when the page is displayed whether or not data is present.

field.name: show_rights
field.label: Show Meta.rights
field.description: If no default is set below, or no value is entered for the item then the global system configurtion default will be used.

field.name: def_rights
field.label: Default Content Rights
field.description: Text to be copied to metadata Content Rights for item if left blank when saved. If both the item rights and this option are blank then the global setting will be used.

field.name: show_desc
field.label: Show Meta.description
field.description: If Yes and no value is entered for the item then the global system configurtion default will be used.

field.name: summary_metadesc
field.label: Summary to Description
field.description: Copy item summary to item metadata description if left blank when saved.

field.name: show_author
field.label: Show Meta.author
field.description: For review pages the reviewer name will be used, for film & people pages the created_by_alias will be used if set, if not the default below will be used. List pages will use the default below.

field.name: def_author
field.label: Default Author
field.description: Used for list views and single film/people pages if created_by_alias is blank.

field.name: metanote2
field.description: NB the Keywords metatag is pretty much deprecated now and you probably don't want to bother with this next option unless you have a particular reason.

field.name: show_keywords
field.label: Show Meta.keywords
field.description: If you are using meta keywords you have the option below to copy tags to the keywords when the item is created

field.name: tags_keywords
field.label: Tags to Keywords
field.description: Copy tags for item to metadata keywords. NB this only works when there is nothing already in the Keyword field

field.name: metanote3
field.description: Joomla inserts a default 'generator' metatag [Joomla! - Open Source Content Management] on all pages. You can change it here for xbFilms pages only. To change it globally use a separate extension.

field.name: def_generator
field.label: Meta.generator
field.description: Leave blank to remove the generator tag.
